name: cyclopentanone, 2-methyl-
Reason: 2-Methylcyclopentanone has a melting point that can be predicted by considering its structural components. The basic unit for comparison is cyclopentane, which has a melting point of -109.4°C (according to the CRC Handbook of Chemistry and Physics, 49th Edition, 1968-1969). The introduction of a methyl group can lower the melting point due to the reduced molecular weight and van der Waals interactions. The methyl group can contribute around -10°C. Additionally, the cyclopentanone ring formation can increase the melting point due to the enhancement of the crystalline structure and the increase in molecular weight. The cyclopentane ring itself has a melting point of -109.4°C, and the methyl group reduces it by approximately -10°C. The cyclopentanone ring formation raises the melting point due to the enhancement of the crystalline structure and the increase in molecular weight.
